The Elder Saddha-Saññaka’s Birth Story
“In the past I was a hunter
in a forest grove,
and there I saw the Buddha,
with a host of gods in front.
He was teaching the Four Truths,
lifting up the great people,
and I heard the sweet voice,
like the sound of a cuckoo bird.
The sage of the Brahma lake,
Sikhī, the friend of the world,
and my mind was gladdened by the sound,
and I attained the destruction of the pollutants.
In the past, twenty-one eons ago,
the deed I did then:
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of my faith.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six supernormal knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Saddha-Saññaka recited these verses.
